@graph.text: What's your favorite way to make potatoes?

headline: Roasted Red Potatoes
name: Roasted Red Potatoes
recipeInstructions: Arrange racks in upper and lower thirds of oven and preheat to 450°.  Toss potatoes with oil, garlic, thyme, salt and pepper in a large bowl until coated. Arrange in an even layer, cut side down, on two rimmed baking sheets.  Roast potatoes, rotating sheets front to back and top to bottom halfway through, until crisp and golden brown on the bottom, 25 to 30 minutes.

video.description: Though fries and fingerlings might get all the love, Roasted Red potatoes are an amazing side dish that can be crispy, creamy and garlicky all at the same time. A must make!
video.name: Roasted Red Potatoes Are A Spud-tacular Side Dish

review.reviewBody: This recipe is so easy and delicious! It continues to get rave reviews in our house. I sometimes use rosemary instead of thyme And it’s always a hit.
Looks perfectly delicious. And thanks for not using baby talk to describe the potatoes (i.e. crispy, yummy, nummy, etc...gag!)

description: Roasted Red Potatoes are by far the easiest and most delicious side to put on a dinner table: thyme, garlic, salt become magic in a hot oven.
keywords: American, dinner party, low sugar, nut-free, side dish, vegetarian, weeknight meals
